rationale: Electrical, Electronic, Instrumentation and allied engineering diploma holders are expected to Design and analyze various Electronic networks. 'Electronic Circuits & Networks' is a core area, the knowledge of which is essential for electronic engineering diploma holders and they need to assimilate it in order to succeed in the Industry. In this regard, the basic knowledge of various theorems, resonance, filtering and attenuation related to passive electronic components is essential. Understanding of these concepts will be useful to determine the various parameters required to solve various problems and applications. This course has been designed to achieve these aims.
competency: Analyze Electronic Circuits & Networks in terms of Voltage, Current Power, Attenuation and Frequency Response.

courseOutcomes.description: Analyze the DC circuit to calculate voltage and current at various points in the circuit.
Understand Concepts Of Two Port Network With Parameters.
Use various network theorems to analyze electronic networks.
Calculate parameters of series/parallel resonant and coupled circuits.
Build different types of Attenuators and constant K-type passive filters.

unitOutcomes.description: Define network elements.
Determine voltage, current and power relationship for resistors connected in series, parallel and in combination
Determine voltage, current and power relationship for capacitors connected in series, parallel and in combination
Determine voltage, current and power relationship for capacitors connected in series, parallel and in combination
Analyze the circuit to calculate voltage and current at various Points in circuit
Explain Energy source and source transformation.
Differentiate between voltage source and current source.
Define various terms related to network topology.

topics.title: Source Transformation
subtopics: Voltage source to current source transformation
Current source to voltage source transformation

topics.title: Mesh Current Method
subtopics: Mesh current method of choosing current variables

unitOutcomes.description: Distinguish the various networks.
Explain Network Configuration
Represent Two Port Parameter
Define various two port impedances
Describe steps to obtain characteristic impedance of standard T and π networks (ZOT and ZOπ)
Describe steps to obtain relation between ZOT and ZOπ
Describe steps of conversion between T to π networks and vice versa

topics.title: Network Classification
subtopics: Single port and Two port Networks

topics.title: Characteristic Impedance
subtopics: Characteristic Impedance of standard T networks (ZOT)
Characteristic Impedance of standard π networks (ZOπ)

unitOutcomes.description: Analyze the circuit to Calculate voltage and current in the given resistive circuits using KCL and KVL
Analyse the resistive circuits to calculate voltage and current using Mesh and nodal analysis method
Explain the steps to find the dual of given circuit having R-L-C
Explain the steps to Calculate the current in any branch of the circuit using Superposition Theorem.
Use Superposition Theorem to calculate the current in any branch of the circuit.
Explain the steps to calculate the Vth, Rth and load current in the circuit using Thevenin's Theorem.
Use Thevenin's Theorem to calculate Vth, Rth and load current in the given circuit.
Explain the steps to calculate the load current in the circuit using Norton's Theorem.
Calculate the load current in the given circuit using Norton's Theorem.
Describe the Maximum Power Transfer condition for any given circuit
Define the Reciprocity Theorem
Determine Quality factor of a Coil and Capacitor.
Analyze the behavior of Series and Parallel resonant circuit using frequency response curve and calculate resonance frequency and various parameters of Series and Parallel resonant circuit.

topics.title: Coupling Coefficient
subtopics: Derive equation for co-efficient of coupling

unitOutcomes.description: Classify various types Of attenuators.
Explain relation between decibel and neper
Using the relation N= Is / IR obtain the equations of R1 and R2for Symmetrical T and π Types of attenuators offering Given amount of attenuation (Kirchhoff's Laws and Mesh analysis)
Define Lattice attenuator
Classify the various passive Filter circuits.
Derive the cut-off frequency equations for constant-k type, T and π sections of low Pass and High Pass filters
Use the pass band equation -1 < Z1 / 4Z2 < 0 to obtain the equation of cut-off frequency for Constant-k type T & π sections- Low Pass and High Pass filters and calculate fc.
Use the equations R02=L/C and the equation for fc to obtain the equations for L and C and calculate values of L and C for given specifications.
Describe limitations of constant-k type filters.
Compare high pass, low pass, band Pass and band stop filters.

topics.title: Band Pass and Band Stop Filters
subtopics: Comparison of band pass and band stop filters

practicalExercises.description: Determine voltage, current and power relationship for resistors connected in series, parallel and in combination.
Calculate current in the given resistive circuits using KCL.
Calculate voltage in the given resistive circuits using KVL.
For a given multisource network, determine the output impedance and voltage and verify it using Thevinin's Theorem
Use Thevenin's Theorem to calculate Vth, Rth and load current for various numericals.
For a given multisource network, determine the value of current in The specified branch and verify it using Superposition theorem.
Use Superposition Theorem to calculate V and I for various numericals.
For a given multisource network, determine the output impedance And voltage and verify it using Norton's Theorem
For a given multisource network, determine the output impedance And voltage and verify it using Maximum power transfer theorem.
For series resonance circuit, determine the frequency response curve to obtain the resonance frequency, resonant impedance, Bandwidth (BW)and Quality factor for series resonance circuit.
For a parallel resonance circuit, determine the frequency response Curve to obtain the resonance frequency, resonant impedance, Bandwidth (BW) and Quality factor.
Calculate resonance frequency and various parameters (Q Factor, BW, and Selectivity) of Series and Parallel resonant circuit.
Build and test T-type, π-type attenuator for given attenuation.
Using the relation N=Is/IR and design equations of R1 and R2 for Symmetrical T and π types of attenuators offering given amount of attenuation solve the numericals.
For the given parameters, build constant K-low pass filter (T and π sections)
For the given parameters, build constant K-high pass filter (T and π sections)
To solve numericals for constant K-low pass and high pass filter (T and π sections)

performanceIndicators.indicator: Operate the equipment setup or circuit

hardware: Dual variable DC power supply, 0-30V, 2A, With Short circuit protection, separate display for voltage and current
Cathode Ray Oscilloscope, Dual Trace 20Mhz, 1MegaΩ Input Impedance
Function Generator 0-2 MHz with Sine, square and triangular output with variable frequency and amplitude
Digital Multimeter: 3 1/2 digit display, 9999 counts digital multimeter measures: Vac, Vdc (1000V max), Adc, Aac (10 amp max), Resistance (0 - 2 Mega Ohm), with diode and transistor tester
Bread Board 840-1000 contact points: Positive and Negative DC power rails on opposite sides of the board
Trainer kit for Network Theorems, Resonance and Passive Filters

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member.
Follow safety practices while using electrical, electronics, pneumatic instruments and tools.
studentActivities: Teacher guided tutorial exercises to solve problems based on all units.
Implement all circuits on breadboard and verify the design.
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/sub topics.
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes.
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature can be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods.
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities.

microProjects.title: Different types of electronic component
microProjects.description: Prepare a board consist of different Resistor, Capacitor, Inductor, chokes, transformer, fuse, diode, and transistor.

programOutcomes.description: Engineering practices for society, sustainability & environment
